bug.author: szymonk211
bug.summary: dnn classification with OpenCl and Intel HD Graphics failure
bug.description:
OpenCV => 3.4.0 Operating System / Platform => Ubuntu 16.04 Compiler => gcc CPU => Intel® Core™ i5-7200U CPU @ 2.50GHz × 4 GPU => Intel® HD Graphics 620 (Kaby Lake GT2)
I installed OpenCV 3.4.0 with Beignet OpenCL with CMake command: <denchmark-code>cmake -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE \ -D WITH_CUDA=OFF \ -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=~/opencv3.4_lib \ -D INSTALL_C_EXAMPLES=ON \ -D INSTALL_PYTHON_EXAMPLES=ON \ -D BUILD_EXAMPLES=OFF \
-D WITH_OPENCL=OFF \ -D HAVE_OPENCL=ON \ -D HAVE_OPENCL_STATIC=ON \ -D OPENCL_LIBRARIES=/usr/local/lib/beignet/libcl.so \ -DOPENCL_INCLUDE_DIRS=/usr/local/lib/beignet/include/CL .. </denchmark-code>
This way I tried to use dnn module for image classification with Intel® HD Graphics 620 (Kaby Lake GT2) GPU. I saw it was possible in here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/wiki/DNN-Efficiency>https://github.com/opencv/opencv/wiki/DNN-Efficiency</denchmark-link> . I ran caffe_googlenet.cpp example: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/3.4.0/samples/dnn/caffe_googlenet.cpp>https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/3.4.0/samples/dnn/caffe_googlenet.cpp</denchmark-link>
When I ran it without OpenCl it worked fine, I got output: Best class: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/1>#1</denchmark-link> 'zle' Probability: 99.9823% Time: 21.4271 ms (average from 100 iterations) (I used AlexNet ) When I turned OpenCl on I got an error: <denchmark-code>[ INFO:0] Initialize OpenCL runtime... OpenCV(ocl4dnn): consider to specify kernel configuration cache directory via OPENCV_OCL4DNN_CONFIG_PATH parameter. [ INFO:0] Successfully initialized OpenCL cache directory: /home/szymon/.cache/opencv/3.4.0/opencl_cache/ [ INFO:0] Preparing OpenCL cache configuration for context: 32-bit--Intel--Intel_R__HD_Graphics_Kabylake_ULT_GT2--1_4 OpenCL program build log: dnn/dummy Status -11: CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE -cl-no-subgroup-ifp -D INTEL_DEVICE error: unknown argument: '-cl-no-subgroup-ifp'

comments.comment:
Beignet OpenCL
Low priority (perhaps bug in OpenCL implementation, but error handling/messaging in OpenCV should be improved). Consider installing SRB5.0 Intel OpenCL runtime: <denchmark-link:https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/opencl-drivers>https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/opencl-drivers</denchmark-link> (should work without additional kernel patches with Ubuntu 4.8+ kernel)

I removed Beignet and installed SRB5.0 just like you proposed. The same program stil gives me almost the same error: [ INFO:0] Initialize OpenCL runtime... OpenCV(ocl4dnn): consider to specify kernel configuration cache directory via OPENCV_OCL4DNN_CONFIG_PATH parameter. [ INFO:0] Successfully initialized OpenCL cache directory: /home/szymon/.cache/opencv/3.4.0/opencl_cache/ [ INFO:0] Preparing OpenCL cache configuration for context: Intel_R__Corporation--Intel_R__HD_Graphics--r5_0_63503 OpenCV Error: Assertion failed (total > 0) in run, file /home/szymon/opencv-3.4.0/modules/core/src/ocl.cpp, line 3060 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'cv::Exception' what(): /home/szymon/opencv-3.4.0/modules/core/src/ocl.cpp:3060: error: (-215) total > 0 in function run Aborted (core dumped)

Could you run program under gdb, set breakpoint on cv::error function and provide stacktrace of this assertion? It would be nice to compile OpenCV with debug information (cmake -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-g" ...) before this.

Here is the stack copied from Eclipse: hello [4696] [cores: 0,1,2,3] Thread <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/1>#1</denchmark-link> [hello] 4696 [core: 2] (Suspended : Signal : SIGABRT:Aborted) __GI_raise() at raise.c:54 0x7ffff0ce8428 __GI_abort() at abort.c:89 0x7ffff0cea02a __gnu_cxx::__verbose_terminate_handler() at 0x7ffff132284d 0x7ffff13206b6 std::terminate() at 0x7ffff1320701 __cxa_throw() at 0x7ffff1320919 cv::error() at system.cpp:964 0x7ffff70092de cv::error() at system.cpp:969 0x7ffff7009371 cv::ocl::Kernel::run() at ocl.cpp:3,060 0x7ffff70a73a6 cv::dnn::ocl4dnn::ocl4dnnGEMV() at math_functions.cpp:470 0x7ffff3363d38 cv::dnn::ocl4dnn::OCL4DNNInnerProduct::Forward() at ocl4dnn_inner_product.cpp:77 0x7ffff3365a59 cv::dnn::FullyConnectedLayerImpl::forward_ocl() at fully_connected_layer.cpp:298 0x7ffff32df3cb cv::dnn::FullyConnectedLayerImpl::forward() at fully_connected_layer.cpp:342 0x7ffff32dfdfc cv::dnn::experimental_dnn_v3::Net::Impl::forwardLayer() at dnn.cpp:1,515 0x7ffff3325153 cv::dnn::experimental_dnn_v3::Net::Impl::forwardToLayer() at dnn.cpp:1,568 0x7ffff3325612 cv::dnn::experimental_dnn_v3::Net::forward() at dnn.cpp:1,770 0x7ffff332702c main() at main.cpp:153 0x409721 Thread <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/2>#2</denchmark-link> [hello] 4703 [core: 0] (Suspended : Container) Thread <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/3>#3</denchmark-link> [hello] 4708 [core: 3] (Suspended : Container) Thread <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/4>#4</denchmark-link> [hello] 4713 [core: 1] (Suspended : Container)

I maybe forgot to mention it earlier, but this is not original AlexNet, but slightly modified version with last layer with 2 output classes, not 1000. I tested the same program with normal AlexNet and actually it works ok. Nevertheles my prototxt and caffemodel files should be correct, because they are classifying correctly under cpu. So there still has to be error somewhere. I can send you my prototxt and caffemodel, so you can retrace the error if you want. In that case just tell how to send you this big caffemodel file.
Does DNN CPU code work with your model?
Opencv DNN CPU works. It also worked on Caffe CUDA and Caffe CPU.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/szymonk211>@szymonk211</denchmark-link> , can you try to set an environment variable ? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/8c2563be41ea8a63b02435138cf9c069eaaa2ca4/modules/dnn/src/ocl4dnn/src/ocl4dnn_conv_spatial.cpp#L133:L135>https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/8c2563be41ea8a63b02435138cf9c069eaaa2ca4/modules/dnn/src/ocl4dnn/src/ocl4dnn_conv_spatial.cpp#L133:L135</denchmark-link>

I ran this model with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/3.4.0/samples/dnn/caffe_googlenet.cpp>https://github.com/opencv/opencv/blob/3.4.0/samples/dnn/caffe_googlenet.cpp</denchmark-link> with --opencl flag, but i changed one line from: Mat inputBlob = blobFromImage(img, 1.0f, Size(224, 224), Scalar(104, 117, 123), false); to Mat inputBlob = blobFromImage(img, 1.0f, Size(227, 227), Scalar(104, 117, 123), false); because AlexNet takes images with different size.
